speaker: Zara
text: I checked the deployment logs from this morning. There’s a service that failed to restart after the database migration.
ipa: aɪ ʧɛkt ðə dɪˈplɔɪmənt lɒɡz frəm ðɪs ˈmɔːnɪŋ. ðɛəz ə ˈsɜːvɪs ðæt feɪld tuː riːˈstɑːt ˈɑːftə ðə ˈdeɪtəbeɪs maɪˈɡreɪʃən.

speaker: Omar
text: Was it the analytics service which runs scheduled ETL jobs?
ipa: wəz ɪt ði ˌænəˈlɪtɪks ˈsɜːvɪs wɪʧ rʌnz ˈʃɛdjuːld iː-tiː-ɛl ʤɒbz?

speaker: Zara
text: Exactly. It relies on a cron expression that didn’t get updated in the latest config map.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli. ɪt rɪˈlaɪz ɒn ə krɒn ɪkˈsprɛʃən ðæt ˈdɪdnt ɡɛt ʌpˈdeɪtɪd ɪn ðə ˈleɪtɪst ˈkɒnfɪɡ mæp.

speaker: Omar
text: That's the same issue which caused last month’s delay. We need a more robust pre-deploy checklist that includes config diffs.
ipa: ðæts ðə seɪm ˈɪʃuː wɪʧ kɔːzd lɑːst mʌnθs dɪˈleɪ. wiː niːd ə mɔː rəʊˈbʌst priː-dɪˈplɔɪ ˈʧɛklɪst ðæt ɪnˈkluːdz ˈkɒnfɪɡ dɪfs.

speaker: Zara
text: Agreed. Also, the rollback script which you wrote for staging was super helpful.
ipa: əˈɡriːd. ˈɔːlsəʊ, ðə ˈrəʊlbæk skrɪpt wɪʧ juː rəʊt fɔː ˈsteɪʤɪŋ wəz ˈsuːpə ˈhɛlpfʊl.

speaker: Omar
text: Oh yeah, that one was inspired by a failure which happened in production during a Blue/Green rollout.
ipa: əʊ jæ, ðæt wʌn wəz ɪnˈspaɪəd baɪ ə ˈfeɪljə wɪʧ ˈhæpənd ɪn prəˈdʌkʃən ˈdjʊərɪŋ ə bluː/ɡriːn ˈrəʊlaʊt.

speaker: Zara
text: I remember that. The engineer who handled it barely had time to revert before alerts flooded in.
ipa: aɪ rɪˈmɛmbə ðæt. ði ˌɛnʤɪˈnɪə huː ˈhændld ɪt ˈbeəli hæd taɪm tuː rɪˈvɜːt bɪˈfɔː əˈlɜːts ˈflʌdɪd ɪn.

speaker: Omar
text: She’s the one who suggested automating the health checks, right?
ipa: ʃiːz ðə wʌn huː səˈʤɛstɪd ˈɔːtəmeɪtɪŋ ðə hɛlθ ʧɛks, raɪt?

speaker: Zara
text: Yep, and she also built the dashboard which now tracks service latency in real time.
ipa: jɛp, ənd ʃiː ˈɔːlsəʊ bɪlt ðə ˈdæʃbɔːd wɪʧ naʊ træks ˈsɜːvɪs ˈleɪtənsi ɪn rɪəl taɪm.

speaker: Omar
text: That dashboard’s the only reason why we caught this so early today.
ipa: ðæt ˈdæʃbɔːdz ði ˈəʊnli ˈriːzn waɪ wiː kɔːt ðɪs səʊ ˈɜːli təˈdeɪ.

speaker: Zara
text: Honestly, it's one of those tools which make you wonder how we managed without them.
ipa: ˈɒnɪstli, ɪts wʌn əv ðəʊz tuːlz wɪʧ meɪk juː ˈwʌndə haʊ wiː ˈmænɪʤd wɪˈðaʊt ðɛm.
